content.en: Cache optimization: Researchers have been investigating how to improve the performance of storage systems by using algorithms to manage cache space and resources. These algorithms, such as CacheCOW and uCache, are designed to meet quality of service requirements and improve cache hit ratio and response time. By optimizing cache allocation and replacement, these algorithms aim to enhance the overall performance of storage systems, including reducing I/O costs and improving read and write performance.
content.da: Cache-optimering: Forskere har undersøgt hvordan man kan forbedre ydeevnen af ​​lagringssystemer ved at bruge algoritmer til at administrere cache-plads og ressourcer. Disse algoritmer, såsom CacheCOW og uCache, er designet til at opfylde kravene til kvalitet af tjeneste og forbedre cache-hit-rate og svartid. Ved at optimere cache-allokering og udskiftning sigter disse algoritmer mod at forbedre den overordnede ydeevne af lagringssystemer, herunder at reducere I/O-omkostninger og forbedre læse- og skriveydelse.
